charm (part 2)

𓈎 𓂋 𓂋 𓊮 | fire | ⲭⲣⲱⲙ khrōm(i) “fire”
𓈎 𓂋 𓂋 𓊮 | fire | qur@Thai qvire doubling

Proto-Indo-European *gʷʰerma “warm, hot”, θερμός (thermós), Latin formus, Sanskrit घर्म (gharma) < péh₂wr̥
Proto-Indo-European *wer- “to burn”, Hittite (warnuzi) Slavonic варити (variti) ⇔ fire

𓈎 𓂋 𓂋 𓊮 | fire (pottery), broil (food) | grill / garen / kocher ⇔ kuchen ⇔ cook ⇔ ceramik !!
𓈎 𓂋 𓂋 𓍔 | fire (pottery), broil (food) | qur@Thai qvire > fire

*Gefeuer > gʷʰer > *wer- “to burn” warnuzi варити variti
*gʷʰer.ma charm = PIE for warm
charm = Semitic for warm

charm 𓐍𓅓𓊮 घर्म gharma warm
charm 𓋴𓂋𓆑𓊮 warm ⇔ worm < Gewürm GVR.ma ⇔ therma

𓎡 𓎛 𓄿 𓏐 | a meal | אֹכֶל ᶜókhel √cook carne comida ჭამა č̣ama 餐 cān
𓈎 𓂋 𓂋 𓊮 | cook | cogh⋍corr კოცონი kˀɔčʰɔni kochen camp(fire)

𒄫 KIR⁴ kiln culīna “kitchen” *kokʷlīna kokeln

𒃲𒃲𒇻 qal-qal-lu •kokeln köchern cook “burn, to roast” ⇔ char

𓆓 𓂝 char/coal

𓆓 𓂝 𓃀 𓏏 𓈒 𓏥 | charcoal, soot | ϫⲉⲃⲥ coal
𓆓 𓂝 𓌠 𓃀 | coal-black |
𓆓 𓂝 𓏏 𓐎 𓏥 | vein (of ore) | žílat , žilka / slot > soot

charcoal was a main trade item in wood deplored centers, as it carries a much higer energy per weight ratio and can thus be brought much more easily from the periferal.

𒀭𒄑𒈦 #'isati ≈ Ishat, Phoenician fire goddess 𒀭𒄑𒈦 #ʰisati ≈ Hestia <> hot heat hearth 𒀭𒄑𒈦 #ᵛisati ≈ Vesta 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar "Fire (god)" Ogun < Shango <> Aggayu > ᵠỌya 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar "Fire (god)" 𓇳 π'RA pyro fire 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar 女火 Nay-Angki - goddess of fire 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar 女火 𒊩𓊮 Nëna e Vatrës 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar ≈ Alaz, god of fire 𒀭𒄑𒈦 an-gis-bar ≈ En/ Enji, god of fire 𒀭𒄑𒈦 <> Arshi Tenger <> 天 Tengri 田 𒀭𒄑𒈦 <> 𒌓 Adyghe ≈ Aed ≈ Eate ≈ Ut Caucasian, Irish, Basque, Siberian goddess of fire / the hearth 𒀭𒄑𒈦 BAR-MAŠ 𒀭𒄑 Prometheus
